tasks.label: (ansible:playbook:environment:cli): Prompts for which environment to use and then symlinks to it
(ansible:playbook:find-missing): Find roles that are missing files
(ansible:populate:dependencies): Attempt to automatically populate `meta/main.yml` and `requirements.yml`
(ansible:test:local): Run the Ansible play on the local machine (or via WSL - see task summary)
(test:docker): Performs a full test, including a test for idempotency, on all available Linux systems using Docker
(test:e2e): Runs a full E2E Molecule test for all supported operating systems
(test:virtualbox): Provisions a desktop VirtualBox VM and then runs a Molecule test
(test:vagrant): Runs the playbook using Vagrant
(common:clean): Removes optional folders that are cached during various tasks
(common:code:count): Display a chart detailing the lines of code for each language used
(common:code:find:todo): Scan code base for TODOs and FIXMEs
(common:commit): Lint staged files, report spelling errors, and open a _required_ commit dialoge
(common:prepare-release): Ensure the project has upstream changes, lint, and then update the version
(common:requirements): Ensure all the dependencies are installed (Node.js, Python, etc.)
(common:reset): Resets the project by removing all caches and updating the project
(common:reset-force): Aggressively reset the project (**WARNING** This will wipe uncommitted work)
(common:shell): Start a terminal session using Docker with any Linux operating system
(common:update:man-page): Build `man` page from the README.md file
(update:modules): Ensure all submodules in the `.modules/` folder are updated
(update:services): Update elements of the repository that require API access
(update): Refresh the project with the latest upstream code and ensure blueprint data has propagated
(docker:build): Build a regular Docker image and then generate a slim build from it
(docker:build:fat): Build a Docker container from the Dockerfile
(docker:build:slim): Build a slim version of the Docker image
(fix:eslint): Fix JavaScript/TypeScript errors automatically
(fix:json): Alphabetically sort JSON
(fix:misc): Perform miscellaneous fixes such as removing BOM and ensuring LF line endings
(fix:packer): Automatically fix and format Packer templates
(fix:prettier): Automatically format most files using Prettier
(fix:python): Automatically format Python files using Black
(fix:shellcheck): (Experimental) Automatically apply fixes to .sh and .sh.j2 files using Shellcheck
(fix:xml): Autofix XML files
(fix:yaml): Autofix YML files
(git:gitlab:group:exec): Execute a shell script across all repositories in a group and commit the changes
(git:remotes): Configure the git remote `origin` to point to GitLab and the git remote `all` to point to GitLab and GitHub
(git:remove:submodules): Remove all submodules in the current directory and optionally filter by RegEx
(image:compress): Compress JPG/PNG images via TinyPNG
(image:resize): Resize an image
(init): Ensures project is initialized with upstream files and migrates pre-existing projects
(lint:all): Lint with all available linters
(lint:ansible): Lint Ansible projects using Ansible Lint
(lint:docker): Lint Dockerfiles using Hadolint (requires Docker)
(lint:eslint): Lint with `eslint`
(lint:esprint:esprint): Lint with `eslint` across multiple threads
(lint:esprint:esprint:stop): Stop the `esprint` process that is currently running
(lint:markdown:markdown): Lint markdown files
(lint:markdown:markdown:links): Scan markdown files for broken links
(lint:packer): Validate the Packer templates ending with `template.json`
(lint:prettier): Lint formatting using Prettier
(lint:prose:prose): Lint for English prose
(lint:python): Lint Python files using Flake8
(lint:shellcheck): Report possible errors in shell scripts
(lint:spelling): Checks for spelling errors in staged files
(lint:toml): Lint TOML files
(lint:vagrant): Validate the Vagrantfile
(lint:xml): Lint XML files
(lint:yaml): Lint .yml files using YAML Lint
(nest:benchmark): Initiate a web server benchmarking session (with `clinic`)
(npm:build): Build the application
(npm:clean): Remove temporary folders that might conflicts with builds
(npm:cov:open): Ensures the code coverage report is generated and opens it in a browser
(npm:cov:upload): Uploads code coverage report to `codecov.io`
(npm:depcheck:dependencies): Remove unused dependencies
(npm:doc:html): Generate TypeDoc HTML documentation
(npm:doc:json): Generate TypeDoc JSON documentation
(npm:start): Run the application
(npm:start:inspect): Run the application in `watch` mode and open DevTools
(npm:start:prod): Run the application in `production` mode
(npm:start:prod:inspect): Run the application in `production` and `watch` mode and open DevTools
(npm:test): Run the unit tests for an NPM project
(npm:test:coverage): Generate code coverage assets
(npm:test:dashboard): Run and manage test cases from a web interface (powered by `majestic`)
(npm:test:debug): Debug tests in `watch` mode
(npm:test:inspect): Debug tests with DevTools in `watch` mode
(npm:typesync): Install missing type definitions
(packer:build:all): Build Packer images for all platforms (default setting uses `template.json`)
(packer:build:kvm): Build a Packer image for KVM
(packer:build:parallels): Build a Packer image for Parallels
(packer:build:virtualbox): Build a Packer image for VirtualBox
(packer:build:vmware): Build a Packer image for VMWare
(prepare): Prepares the project for the normal start command
(publish:android:beta): Publishes Android app to Firebase beta channel
(publish:android:release): Publishes Android app to Google Play
(publish:app:beta): Publish a beta release of all the release targets
(publish:app:release): Publish a production release of all the targets
(publish:brew:cask): Publishes a Homebrew Cask
(publish:brew:formula): Publishes a Homebrew Formula
(publish:chrome:release): Publishes Chrome extension
(publish:ios:beta): Publishes iOS app to Firebase beta channel
(publish:ios:release): Publishes iOS app to iTunes
(publish:opera:release): Publishes Opera extension
(python:build): Build the project
(python:build:binary): Build standalone binary
(python:publish): Publish the project to PyPi.org
(python:requirementstxt): Generate the requirements.txt fallback file
(python:run): Runs the project by calling `run.py`
(python:test): Runs tests with `pytest` after fixing and linting
(security:bandit): Check for Python code security issues
(security:dockle): Analyze and lint the Docker container using Dockle
(security:gitleaks): Scans repository (including git history) for possible leaked keys
(security:private-keys): Scan for private keys
(security:snyk): Analyze the Docker container for security vulnerabilities with Snyk (requires login)
(security:trivy): Analyze the Docker container for security vulnerabilities with Trivy
(start): Set up the project and refresh it with the latest changes
(symlink:playbook): Symlink all the roles in the roles/ folder to ~/.ansible/roles
(symlink:role): Symlink the current role to ~/.ansible/roles/.
